Dear Derrick McCree:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at 517-243-8743.
Sincerely,
Nabiha Rizk, Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Sufficiency of staff.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126
Section (1) The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
Description supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative
rules and in the agency's program statement and to provide for the
continual needs, protection, and supervision of residents
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 12/16/24, several youths popped the locks on the pod doors
and the doors to another unit and assaulted several youth and
staff on the unit. The youth were arrested.
Investigation Administrator called on 12/17/2024, and reported on 12/16/2024
law enforcement was contacted due to Youth A, Youth B, and
Youth C, popping the lock using a laminate paper and piece of
cloth. They got out of the pod, assaulted staff and Manager 1 who
was in the hallway, and snatched Manager 1’s badge from around
his neck. The three youths went to pod 3, using Manager 1’s
badge they opened the pod door, attempted to assault Youth D,
but staff were able to verbally redirect the three youths to leave
the pod. The three youths (Youth A, Youth B and Youth C) then
went to pod 1, attempted to assault Youth E, however staff circled
around Youth E, and verbally redirected the three youths to return
to their pod. The police were contacted, and Youth A and Youth B
were arrested for assaulting staff. No youth was injured as a result
of the incident.
Administrator was interviewed at the facility. Administrator
reported Youth A is currently at JDC and Youth B is at Highland
Park Jail. She said Youth B is 18 years old, therefore he will be
transferred to Wayne County Jail. She said Manager 1 and Staff 1
have been sent for medical exams due to being assaulted by
Youth A and Youth B. Administrator reported that no youth was
injured or hurt as a result of the incident. Youth C was not arrested
because he did not assault staff during the incident.
Youth C was interviewed at the facility on 12/19/2024. Youth C
refused to participate in the interview. A second attempt was
made to interview Youth C on 12/20/2024 and again Youth C
refused to participate in the interview.
2

Youth D was interviewed at the facility on 12/19/2024. Youth D is
placed on pod 3 and there are five youths on the pod including
him. Youth C reported on 12/16/2024 he was getting ready to step
down for the night, and that’s when Youth A, Youth B, and Youth
C entered pod 3. He said Youth A and Youth B were trying to start
a fight with him, but Staff 1 intervened and redirected the three
youths out of the pod. Youth D denied being hurt or injured during
the incident. Youth D does not know how the three youths were
able to enter the pod. Youth D reported there are always staff
supervising them on the pod and did not express any concerns
regarding staff.
Youth E was interviewed at the facility on 12/19/2024. Youth E is
placed on pod 1. Youth E reported on 12/17/2024, Youth A, Youth
B, and Youth C entered pod 1 and were trying to fight him. He
said staff on the pod immediately told all the youths on the pod to
step down. Youth E said several staff members were following
Youth A, Youth B, and Youth C, trying to get them to leave the
pod. Youth E could not recall the staff’s names, but said staff did
intervene and were able to have the three youths leave the pod.
Youth E denied getting injured or hurt.
Youth B was interviewed at the Highland Park Police Department
on 12/19/2024. Youth B reported he was at the facility for 7
months and was on pod 8 with Youth A and Youth C. Youth B said
on 12/16/2024, he and the other youths were upset because they
were scheduled to get haircuts and were told their haircuts were
cancelled. He admitted he was upset also because his room was
searched a few days prior, and they found he had a cell phone.
He initially refused to say where he got the cell phone from, but
then said Manager 2 gave him the cell phone. Youth B denied he
was the one that popped the lock and said he didn’t know how the
lock was popped, but admitted that he walked out of the pod with
Youth A and Youth C. Youth B said they encountered Manager 1
in the hallway, Youth A grabbed Manager 1’s badge from around
his neck, and that’s when Manager 1 grabbed Youth A, therefore
Youth B pushed Staff 1, and punched Manager 1. Youth B said he
was only trying to help Youth A. Youth B reported they were able
to get away from Staff 1 and Manager 1, and they went to pod 1
and pod 3 using Manager 1’s badge, because Youth A wanted to
fight Youth D who was in Pod 3. He said they eventually returned
to pod 8 and that’s when the police arrived, and he was arrested.
Staff 1 was interviewed at the facility on 12/20/2024.
Staff 1 reported on 12/16/2024 Youth B was upset because the
barber visit was cancelled for their pod. Youth B became
3

escalated yelling, throwing chairs, and flipped tables. Youth B told
Youth A “lets destroy this pod.” Youth B and Youth C went to the
exit door and started fidgeting with the lock. He and Staff 2 tried
to verbally des-escalate Youth B, and that’s when Youth A and
Youth C popped the lock on the door and exited the pod with
Youth B. He followed the three youths and encountered Manger 1
in the hallway. Youth A jumped on Manager 1 and grabbed his
badge, Youth B pushed Staff 1 and assaulted Manager 1,
dropping Manger 1 to the floor. The three youths ran down the
hallway and entered pod 5. Staff 1 ran after them and followed
them to pod 5. He and Staff 3 attempted to verbally redirect the
three youths out of pod 5. He said Youth A was trying to fight
Youth D, but he was able to stand between them and stop the
fight. Youth A, Youth B, and Youth C left pod 5. He said he
attempted to get Manager 1’s badge, but Youth A refused and left
pod 5. He and Staff 3 followed the three youths to Pod 1. Youth A
tried to fight Youth E and he and Staff 3 attempted to verbally
redirect Youth A, Youth B, and Youth C to leave pod 1. He said
the three Youths returned to pod 8 and that’s when Law
Enforcement arrived and arrested Youth A and Youth B. Staff 1
said he sustained a concussion from being pushed by Youth B
and hitting his head.
Staff 2 was interviewed at the facility on 12/20/2024. Staff 2
reported Youth B was upset because Manager 1 cancelled their
haircuts and became irate. Youth B started yelling and throwing
chairs. He and Staff 2 attempted to verbally de-escalate Youth B,
and that’s when Youth A and Youth C popped the lock and exited
the pod. He was shocked that Youth A and Youth C were able to
use a lamented paper and piece of cloth to pop the lock. He said
Staff 1 followed Youth A, Youth B, and Youth C, and he stayed on
the pod supervising Youth E and therefore did not witness what
happened after the three youths left the pod.
Manager 1 was interviewed at the facility on 12/20/2024. Manger
1 reported he was responding to a call from pod 8 due to Youth A
and Youth B being upset about their haircuts being rescheduled.
He said Youth A and Youth B had been upset about a previous
incident involving Manager 2 doing a room search and finding
Youth B had a cell phone. He was going to pod 8 to help with de-
escalating the youths, and that’s when he encountered Youth A,
Youth B, and Youth C, in the hallway. He said Youth A jumped
him and started to punch him on his back and side. Youth C was
in between his legs and Youth B attacked Staff 1. He was knocked
to the floor and that’s when Youth A grabbed his badge, and the
three youths ran down the hallway. The three youths entered pod
4

5 and attempted to fight with Youth D. Staff 1 and Staff 3 were
able to de-escalate and get Youth A, Youth B, and Youth C to
leave pod 5. He went to the control room and called law
enforcement while Staff 1 and Staff 3 followed the three youths to
pod 1. He said Staff 1 and Staff 3 were able to get Youth A, Youth
B, and Youth C to return to pod 8, and that’s when law
enforcement arrived. Youth A and Youth B were arrested and
taken into custody. Manager 1 reported he felt very sick after the
incident because he has asthma and was having a hard time
breathing after the incident.
Clinical Director was interviewed at the facility on 12/26/2024.
Clinical Director reported she is the assigned therapist for Youth
A, Youth B, and Youth C. Clinical Director reported that Manager
2 had completed a room search and found a cell phone in Youth
B’s room. She said Youth B refused to say where he got the cell
phone. She said Youth A and Youth B were upset about having
the cell phone taken away and this may have contributed to this
incident.
Youth A was interviewed at the JDC on 12/26/2024. Youth A
refused to participate in the interview.
Manager 2 was interviewed at the facility on 12/27/2024. Manager
2 was not working on 12/16/2024. Manager 2 reported on
12/14/2024 Staff 4 informed him that Youth B had a cell phone.
Manager 2 completed a room search and found a cell phone. He
said Youth B refused to say where he got the cell phone and
therefore got mad at Manager 2 for taking the cell phone.
Manager 2 said he heard a rumor that Youth A was saying he
gave them the cell phone. Manager 2 denied giving Youth B a cell
phone. He said Youth A and Youth B were retaliating against him
because he took the cell phone away from them.
Staff 3 was interviewed at the facility on 12/27/2024. Staff 3
reported he responded to assist when Youth A, Youth B, and
Youth C breached pod 8 and entered pod 1 and pod 5. Staff 3
said he and Staff 1 verbally redirected Youth A, Youth B, and
Youth C from pod 1 and pod 5. Staff 3 did not witness Youth A,
Youth B, and Youth C assault Staff 1 and Manager 1. Staff 3
denied witnessing or having knowledge of Youth B having a cell
phone.
Staff 4 was interviewed at the facility on 12/27/2024. Staff 4
reported he witnessed Youth B with a cell phone on 12/14/2024
and immediately notified Manager 2. Staff 4 said Manager 2
5

conducted a room search and found the cell phone. Staff 4 denied
witnessing any staff member or Manager 2 provide Youth B with
the cell phone.
Youth F was interviewed on 12/27/2024. Youth F was watching
television and denied witnessing Youth A, and Youth C, pop the
lock and exit the pod. Youth F said he does not like to get involved
and usually keeps to himself. Youth F reported Youth B told him
about the cell phone and told him that Manager 2 gave him a cell
phone. Youth B denied witnessing any staff member or Manager 2
give Youth B a cell phone. Youth F reported feeling safe and all
his needs are being met.
Video Reviewed:
Video footage of pod 8 was reviewed on 12/19/2024. It should be
noted video does not have audio. Staff 1 and Staff 2 are on the
pod with Youth A, Youth B, and Youth C. Youth A is seen arguing
with Staff 2, Youth B is escalated, and he flips the table and
chairs. Youth A and Youth C walked towards the exit door. Youth
A held a piece of cloth and Youth C was holding a lamented
paper. Staff 1 and Staff 2 followed Youth A and Youth B and
appeared to be talking to the two youths. Staff 1 and Staff 2 went
back to the other side of the pod and were talking to Youth B.
Youth A and Youth C continued to fidget with the door for
approximately 6 minutes and were able to unlock the door. It
appears that Staff 1 and Staff 2 made no attempt to stop the two
youths while they were attempting to pop the locks. Youth A,
Youth B, and Youth C exit the pod. Staff 1 followed the three
youths down the hallway, Manager 1 was walking towards the
three youths. Staff 1 and Manager 1 appeared to be talking to the
three youths, Youth A assaulted Manager 1, Youth C assaulted
Staff 1 and the three youths run down the hallway. The three
youths enter pod 5, Staff 1 followed the three youths on pod 5,
Staff 3 and Staff 1 attempted to redirect the three youths out of
pod 5, Youth A attempted to fight Youth D, Staff 1 stood in
between the two youths. The three youths left pod 5 and entered
pod 1, Staff 1 and Staff 3 followed the three youths to pod 1.
Youth A ran up to Youth E and attempted to punch Youth E, Staff
1 and Staff 3 stood between Youth A and Youth E. Youth A, Youth
B, and Youth C exited pod 1 and retuned back to pod 8. Law
enforcement then arrived and arrested Youth A and Youth B.
Documents Reviewed:
• Incident report for resident assault on staff and peer/pod
breach, dated 12/16/2024, written by Manager 1 is
consistent with Manager 1’s interview.
6

• Agency response dated 11/17/2024 confirms Staff 1 and
Staff 2 were put on administrative leave pending the
investigation.
• Staff 1 does not have any disciplinary records. Staff 1
completed MANDT verbal de-escalation 09/12/24 and
09/16/2024.
• Staff 2 does not have any disciplinary records. Staff 2
completed MANDT verbally de-escalation 09/12/24 and
09/16/2024.
Analysis The facility is found in non-compliance as per interviews
conducted, video reviewed, and documentation, Staff 1 and Staff
2 failed to intervene or stop Youth A, Youth B, and Youth C when
they popped the lock on the pod. The youths were trying for six
minutes to unlock the door and both staff failed to stop the youths
from popping the lock.
Conclusion Violation Established
Rule Code Incident reporting
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4150
Section (4) When a resident's behavior results in contact with law
Description enforcement, the incident shall be reported to the parent/legal
guardian, responsible referring agency, and the licensing authority
as soon as possible, but not more than 24 hours after the incident.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation The agency did not notify licensing or centralized intake timely.
Investigation Administrator reported centralized intake was not contacted
immediately because no youth was injured as a result of the three
youths popping the lock and getting out of the pod. She said
Youth A and Youth B assaulted and hurt staff not youths. The
incident occurred on 12/16/24 around 9:00pm and she did contact
licensing and Centralized intake on 12/17/2024. She said staff are
trained and instructed to immediately report any incident of abuse
and neglect to MDHHS and report the incident to their supervisor.
Administrator also reported the applicable parties are notified
when youth’s behavior escalates to having contact with law
enforcement.
Clinical Director, Manager 1 and Staff 1, all reported they are
instructed/trained to report incidents of abuse and neglect to the
Director and contact MDHHS as well writing incident reports and
7

notifying the applicable parties when a youth behavior escalates to
having contact law enforcement involvement.
This consultant received a phone call from Administrator on
12/17/2024 reporting the incident involving Youth A and Youth B.
Document reviewed:
• Facility youth protection law compliance policy each staff
person is required to report immediately both verbally and
in writing to their immediate supervisor any incident where
he or she has reasonable cause to suspect youth abuse or
neglect. Staff must also report suspected child abuse
directly to MDHHS 855-444-3911.
• Facility incident notification policy states any incident
resulting in serious injury of a youth or illness requiring
inpatient hospitalization she be reported to parent/legal
guardian, responsible referring agency and licensing
authority as soon as possible but not more than 24 hours
following the incident.
• Incident report for resident assault on staff and peer/pod
breach, dated 12/16/2024, written by Manager 1.
Analysis The facility is in compliance with reporting the incident to licensing
within the 24 hours of the incident occurring.
Technical Assistance:
Technical assistance was offered to the facility to update their
incident notification policy to ensure it addresses all aspects of the
licensing rule including AWOL and contact with law enforcement
Conclusion Violation Not Established
8

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
